hypothesis_content.title: US Market Hour Breakout Acceleration
hypothesis_content.statement: A breakout signal (price > 1-day high) that triggers during the first 2 hours of the US equity market open (14:30-16:30 UTC) has a higher probability of sustained momentum (3% move) than breakouts occurring in the Asian or European sessions during NEUTRAL regimes.
hypothesis_content.rationale: The US session brings the highest liquidity and institutional participation. A breakout coinciding with this influx of capital and attention is more likely to be 'real' and attract follow-through buying, especially in a neutral market awaiting a catalyst.
entry_conditions: BTC price breaks above the prior day's high (daily close basis)
Break occurs between 14:30 UTC and 16:30 UTC

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price increases 3% from the breakout level
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price closes below the prior day's high (invalidating the breakout)
exit_conditions.time_exit: End of the trading day (21:00 UTC)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakouts during the specified US window show a success rate (reaching 3% target) not statistically higher than breakouts in other major trading sessions.
